messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tag lines
messages.msgSnippet: well, it is a simple statement.. but one that is SO important.. too bad it took me about fifty years to figure it out.. i remember as a self concious teen
messages.messageBody:
well, it is a simple statement.. but one that is SO important.. too bad it took me about fifty years to figure it out.. i remember as a self concious teen realizing that what other's thought did not really affect me.. .. but it took another forty years for that to really sink in..

That will be one of my new mottos..-- What you think of me is none of my business!!
in fact think i'll put it on a tshirt.. it is a surprising way to put such a basic truth..

L
----- Original Message -----
From: Tia Leschke
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, July 08, 2002 12:46 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tag lines



>i love these tag lines also..
>where di the "what you think of me.... " one come from.. i LOVE it!!

Thanks to both of you who commented. The what you think of me one is
actually the title of a book. I can't remember if I ever finished the
book, but the title stuck with me. It's how I try to live and something I
hope rubs off on my kids.
Tia

What you think of me is none of my business.
*********************************************************
Tia Leschke leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

Linda LL
----- Original Message -----
From: debi watson
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, July 08, 2002 9:27 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Teaching, learning, looking for advice... (LONG)



No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
You know, Tia, I have been reading this tag line of yours for a while now, but it just struck me again how truly appropriate it is -- that and your other one, "What you think of me is none of my business"! Debi
*********************************************
